page.title: 05NEWCOMERS 2
page.content: When living in a town, the tranquility of village life can see attractive. People are friendlier. There is a "community spirit". There are numerous activities based on the centre of the village, the village hall. They do not have to content with the polution, the hustle and bustle, and the violence of the town. Of course, it has its drawbacks. There is very little local employment and there are few shops making personal transport essential. A newcomer without a car and being used to ammenities on the doorstep can feel very isolated in rural areas. Youngsters can feel very out of place when they are suddenly faced with making their own entertainment. On the whole however, people adjust and in most cases moves from town to village work out and become permanent.
